channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Outside no.10, 2nd December
item.description:
All the area around has been done from hamsptead lane up until 11 the grove. The pavement outside 10 has been untouched for some reason so they are requesting the work be finished up until outside their property.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9c, The Grove, Highgate, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The manhole is sinking in and lifting up one corner which is very dangerous for the public when walking., 2nd December
item.description:
The manhole cover is lifting up as it's sinking from one side. The tarmac appears to have fallen away on one side hence the issue arising. This footpath is used by many people including young children and needs to be fixed asap to avoid accidents.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eastern Avenue, Redbridge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Durfey Place, 2nd December
item.description:
I reported this yesterday, and it was closed because apparently you couldn't find the rubbish. Well, as you can see it's still here. Can you please take it away?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Durfey Place, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping on Union Street under the arches, 2nd December
item.description:
I reported the problem yesterday (see first photo). I got an email today saying it has been fixed. However, rubbish is till there today but in a more compact form. Please kindly remove, and provide an accurate update on it

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 235-241, Union Street, Southwark, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Public pedestrian walk destroyed, 2nd December
item.description:
A private construction company is conducting work at 162 Elmstead Lane. In the process, they have churned up mud everywhere along the path, destroyed the grass strip, and broken the pavement, which is severely cracked and entire large chunks have broken off along the edges of the path. The company's details are publicly visible on a sign they have put up on the construction site.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmstead Lane, Elmstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, 2nd December
item.description:
This car appears to have been abandoned in a public parking bay in Woodstock Gardens, BR3 5XB. It has not been moved for at least 10 weeks and has a broken rear windscreen wiper.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodstock Gardens, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TFL box but on council pavement, 2nd December
item.description:
With all due respect this box was reported over the year ago replied was it belongs to TfL for London which if technically it does that's another matter but it is cautionary structition on Bexley borough footpaths so the owner's responsibility must Bexley to get it sorted out if you want to to have pride in our borough then it's got to start somewhere which is with yourself doing your part please consist be addressed as soon as possible and preferably this year

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 164, Halfway Street, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, 2nd December

item.title: Parked illegally, 2nd December
item.description:
Lime bikes and scooters all parked outside of their bay overflowing into pay and display and resident only bays. Now on double yellow lines blocking the way for emergency vehicles. This is a daily occurrence and is absolutely disgraceful. You must regulate and fine companies that allow this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Church Row, Belsize Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lc58 UEG, 2nd December
item.description:
This car pulls up and chucks rubbish in the bushes. Two women, look like 50 year old Vicky Pollards. They are the residents of Phoenix Community Housing. They could have applied for Shameless on channel 4 and wouldn't have needed to do any acting.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Swiftsden Way, Downham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
